ygData.subject: Parameter settings
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi: I m currently working on a modification to NEAT (using a genetic regulatory network to create a more flexible genome), and I had a question about parameter

Subject: Parameter settings
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=3276197
X-Yahoo-Profile: bpadams


Hi:

I'm currently working on a modification to NEAT (using a genetic
regulatory network to create a more flexible genome), and I had a
question about parameter settings.

I'm starting by benchmarking the system with the XOR test, and I have
reproduced the original NEAT results (solutions in an average of 3600
evaluations over several hundred runs).  However, when I add some new
code, I'm faced with the problem of not just setting my own new
parameters, but potentially changing the standard NEAT parameters.

My question, then, is this: how do you set the parameters that govern
the NEAT system?  I've played with mutation rates (especially
structural), speciation settings (including dynamic thresholding), and
the other odds and ends (popsize, minimum size for elitism, fraction
of parents to reproduce, weight caps), but I'm not always sure what
I'm looking for when I make changes.  What, aside from a solution, are
the variables to look for when evaluating the quality of a run?

And I will provide bonus stars for anyone who has a non-ad-hoc
approach to setting some of these variables.  :)

I appreciate any thoughts or suggestions,

--Bryan
